vocabulary.definition: relating to the ocean or sea
vocabulary.example: Marine animals live in the salty ocean water

vocabulary.definition: moving water in the ocean that flows like a river
vocabulary.example: The ocean current carried the fish to warmer waters

vocabulary.definition: the deepest parts of the ocean
vocabulary.example: Strange creatures live in the ocean depths

vocabulary.definition: colorful living structures that grow in warm ocean water
vocabulary.example: The coral reef was home to many tropical fish

vocabulary.definition: the rising and falling of ocean water twice each day
vocabulary.example: At low tide, we could see shells on the beach

vocabulary.definition: the top layer of the ocean water
vocabulary.example: Dolphins jumped above the ocean surface

vocabulary.definition: moving bumps of water caused by wind
vocabulary.example: The surfer rode the big waves to shore

vocabulary.definition: tall seaweed that grows like underwater forests
vocabulary.example: Sea otters wrap themselves in kelp to stay in one place

vocabulary.definition: all the living things in an area and how they work together
vocabulary.example: The coral reef ecosystem has many colorful fish

vocabulary.definition: to find your way from one place to another
vocabulary.example: Whales navigate across thousands of miles of ocean

vocabulary.definition: a boat that can travel underwater
vocabulary.example: The submarine explored the deep ocean floor

vocabulary.definition: strange and hard to understand
vocabulary.example: The mysterious sounds came from deep in the ocean

vocabulary.definition: the natural home where an animal lives
vocabulary.example: The coral reef is a perfect habitat for tropical fish

vocabulary.definition: to move from one place to another with the seasons
vocabulary.example: Gray whales migrate thousands of miles each year

vocabulary.definition: colors or patterns that help animals hide
vocabulary.example: The octopus used camouflage to blend with the rocks

vocabulary.definition: an animal that hunts other animals for food
vocabulary.example: The shark is a fierce predator in the ocean

vocabulary.definition: tiny floating plants and animals in the ocean
vocabulary.example: Many ocean animals eat plankton for food

vocabulary.definition: the ability of living things to make their own light
vocabulary.example: Deep sea creatures use bioluminescence to communicate

vocabulary.definition: the deepest, darkest parts of the ocean
vocabulary.example: Strange creatures live in the ocean abyss

vocabulary.definition: the variety of different living things in one place
vocabulary.example: Coral reefs have amazing biodiversity
